case_vignette: a 12-year-old healthy male presents for evaluation of rash on the chest and back ongoing for the past 4 days. mother reports that she first noticed a larger spot on his right flank, then smaller similar lesions began developing all over the chest and back. she denies any history of eczema for the patient or family history. she denies any new topical products. the rash is not painful or itchy. mother has tried topical over the counter hydrocortisone without any improvement. physical examination is remarkable for erythematous pink thin papules and plaqueswith overlying fine thin scale on the back and chest. a larger thin scaly plaque is appreciated on the right flank. a koh preparation is performed and does not reveal any fungal elements
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my chest and back that started with a larger spot on my right flank and then smaller similar spots spread.
How long have you had the rash?
I've had the rash for 4 days.
Do the spots on the rash itch or hurt?
No, the rash is not painful or itchy.
Have you noticed any fever or other systemic symptoms recently?
No, I haven't noticed any fever or other symptoms.
Have you had chickenpox before or been vaccinated against it?
The information about whether I've had chickenpox before or been vaccinated against it isn't provided.
Do you have any known allergies or other health conditions?
No, I am a healthy individual with no known allergies or other health conditions.
Is there any family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
No, there is no family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis Rosea
